name: Stably
headline: AI agent that does QA testing. Runnable in your CI.
description:
Stably helps product teams ship fast without breaking things. Our AI analyzes your web apps, generates comprehensive test scripts, and adapts to changes on the fly. 

Testing for mobile is coming soon.
tags: industry:developer-tools; industry:saas; industry:devops; industry:web-development; industry:ai; location:san-francisco-bay-area

founders.name: Jinjing Liang, Co-founder & CEO
founders.description: Building Stably - AI-powered QA Testing. Prev senior engineer @Google Chrome. 2x founder and Cornell alum.

founders.name: Neil Parker, Founder
founders.description:
Stably Co-Founder and CEO. Previously engineering lead at Uber.

I love building products that delight our users!

## Playwright 2.0
AI-powered actions and assertions that extend beyond Playwright's limits, while being significantly faster to write
![Stably Logo](https://www.stably.ai/logo-shape-only.svg)
## Stably Test
Find all tasks that were created more than 30 days ago and have a status of either "blocked" or "on-hold".Delete these tasks one by one until the list is empty, verify the page displays an image that shows relaxation.
![Playwright Logo](https://www.stably.ai/playwright-logo.svg)
## Playwright Test
```
// Complex regex to match task dates and statuses
const dateRegex = /(?:Jan|Feb|Mar|Apr|May|Jun|Jul|Aug|Sep|Oct|Nov|Dec)
 s+d{1,2}(?:st|nd|rd|th)?
 s+(?:202[0-4])/i;
const statusRegex = /^
 (?=.*(?:blocked|on-hold))
 (?!.*(?:in-progress|done))
 .*$/i;
while (true) {
 // Find all task elements using complex compound selector
 const tasks = await page.$$(
  'div[data-testid^="task-item-"]:visible' +
  ':has(> div[class*="task-content"])'
 );
 if (tasks.length === 0) break;
 for (const task of tasks) {
  const dateText = await task.$eval(
   'div[class*="metadata"]' +
   ' >> span:has-text("Created")' +
   ' >> span.date-field:not(:empty)',
   el => el.textContent
  );
  const statusText = await task.$eval(
   'div[class*="status"]' +
   ' >> span.status-badge:not(.hidden)' +
   ':has-text(/blocked|on-hold/i)',
   el => el.textContent
  );
  
  const taskDate = new Date(
   dateText.match(dateRegex)[0]
  );
  
  // Check if task is older than 30 days and matches status
  const isOldTask = 
   Date.now() - taskDate.getTime() > 
   30 * 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000;
  
  if (isOldTask && statusRegex.test(statusText.trim())) {
   // Open task menu and click delete using role and aria attributes
   await task.click(
    'button[aria-label="Task actions"]:visible' +
    ' >> .task-menu-trigger'
   );
   await page.click(
    'role=menuitem[name="Delete task"]' +
    ' >> [data-testid="delete-task-btn"]'
   );
   
   // Handle confirmation dialog
   await page.click(
    'button:has-text("Confirm Delete")'
   );
   await page.waitForResponse(response => 
    response.url().includes('/api/tasks/delete')
   );
   
   // Break after deleting one item to let the list refresh
   break;
  }
 }
}
```

## Run tests however you want
Run tests manually or automatically in your CI/CD pipeline on every PR. Deploy with confidence using notifications via Slack, GitHub, Linear, or email.

FAQ
What is Stably?
[Stably](https://www.stably.ai/<https:/www.stably.ai>)uses AI to automate QA testing for product teams. You can record actions or describe steps in plain language to create a test. Our visual editor lets you preview AI-generated interactions in real time so you can be sure it does what you want. Our AI also handles running the tests and maintaining the tests.
How does Stably work with Playwright / Selenium / Cypress?
Our AI generates Playwright code to drive the browser automation. Some code is statically generated while you record actions, whereas code for dynamic steps is generated on the fly during run time.
What kind of companies use Stably?
We serve product/engineering teams of all sizes, from large enterprise companies to startups, solo founders, dev shops, and more. Our platform is compatible with your existing QA or end-to-end testing workflow, and you can use Stably for part or all of your tests.
Who on my team should use Stably?
Both engineers and non-engineers can use Stably if they understand the application's business logic. Half of our user base is technical, and half is non-technical.
What common bugs can I prevent with Stably? 
We help you catch bugs in the front-end, back-end, or integration part. Common bugs we have helped our users see are authentication issues, permission issues, payment issues, DB transaction issues, etc.
Stop using your customers as the QA
And set up Stably today. Get your first test up and running in under 5 minutes.
[Start free trial](https://www.stably.ai/<https:/tally.so/r/3yvAxx>)

## Playwright 2.0
AI-powered actions and assertions that extend beyond Playwright's limits, while being significantly faster to write
![Stably Logo‚ü®29‚ü©]
## Stably Test
Find all tasks that were created more than 30 days ago and have a status of either "blocked" or "on-hold".Delete these tasks one by one until the list is empty, verify the page displays an image that shows relaxation.
![Playwright Logo‚ü®30‚ü©]
## Playwright Test
```
// Complex regex to match task dates and statuses
const dateRegex = /(?:Jan|Feb|Mar|Apr|May|Jun|Jul|Aug|Sep|Oct|Nov|Dec)
 s+d{1,2}(?:st|nd|rd|th)?
 s+(?:202[0-4])/i;
const statusRegex = /^
 (?=.*(?:blocked|on-hold))
 (?!.*(?:in-progress|done))
 .*$/i;
while (true) {
 // Find all task elements using complex compound selector
 const tasks = await page.$$(
  'div[data-testid^="task-item-"]:visible' +
  ':has(> div[class*="task-content"])'
 );
 if (tasks.length === 0) break;
 for (const task of tasks) {
  const dateText = await task.$eval(
   'div[class*="metadata"]' +
   ' >> span:has-text("Created")' +
   ' >> span.date-field:not(:empty)',
   el => el.textContent
  );
  const statusText = await task.$eval(
   'div[class*="status"]' +
   ' >> span.status-badge:not(.hidden)' +
   ':has-text(/blocked|on-hold/i)',
   el => el.textContent
  );
  
  const taskDate = new Date(
   dateText.match(dateRegex)[0]
  );
  
  // Check if task is older than 30 days and matches status
  const isOldTask = 
   Date.now() - taskDate.getTime() > 
   30 * 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000;
  
  if (isOldTask && statusRegex.test(statusText.trim())) {
   // Open task menu and click delete using role and aria attributes
   await task.click(
    'button[aria-label="Task actions"]:visible' +
    ' >> .task-menu-trigger'
   );
   await page.click(
    'role=menuitem[name="Delete task"]' +
    ' >> [data-testid="delete-task-btn"]'
   );
   
   // Handle confirmation dialog
   await page.click(
    'button:has-text("Confirm Delete")'
   );
   await page.waitForResponse(response => 
    response.url().includes('/api/tasks/delete')
   );
   
   // Break after deleting one item to let the list refresh
   break;
  }
 }
}
```

## Run tests however you want
Run tests manually or automatically in your CI/CD pipeline on every PR. Deploy with confidence using notifications via Slack, GitHub, Linear, or email.

FAQ
What is Stably?
Stably‚ü®44‚ü©uses AI to automate QA testing for product teams. You can record actions or describe steps in plain language to create a test. Our visual editor lets you preview AI-generated interactions in real time so you can be sure it does what you want. Our AI also handles running the tests and maintaining the tests.
How does Stably work with Playwright / Selenium / Cypress?
Our AI generates Playwright code to drive the browser automation. Some code is statically generated while you record actions, whereas code for dynamic steps is generated on the fly during run time.
What kind of companies use Stably?
We serve product/engineering teams of all sizes, from large enterprise companies to startups, solo founders, dev shops, and more. Our platform is compatible with your existing QA or end-to-end testing workflow, and you can use Stably for part or all of your tests.
Who on my team should use Stably?
Both engineers and non-engineers can use Stably if they understand the application's business logic. Half of our user base is technical, and half is non-technical.
What common bugs can I prevent with Stably? 
We help you catch bugs in the front-end, back-end, or integration part. Common bugs we have helped our users see are authentication issues, permission issues, payment issues, DB transaction issues, etc.
Stop using your customers as the QA
And set up Stably today. Get your first test up and running in under 5 minutes.

generated_description:
**Stably: Revolutionizing QA Testing with AI** 

Founded in 2022, Stably is a San Francisco-based startup that emerged from the prestigious Y Combinator Batch W22. At its core, Stably is on a mission to help product teams accelerate their development process while ensuring that quality is never compromised. 

### What Does Stably Do?

Stably leverages AI to automate the quality assurance (QA) testing process for web applications. Imagine having an AI agent that not only analyzes your application but also generates comprehensive test scripts and adapts seamlessly to changes in real time. That's Stably for you. It minimizes the flakiness often associated with automated tests, ensuring consistency even as your software evolves. 

### Key Features

- **No-Code Editor**: Users can create tests in plain English, which makes it accessible not just to engineers but to anyone on a product team.
- **AI-Powered Tests**: The AI not only writes tests but also runs and maintains them, adapting as your app changes.
- **CI/CD Integration**: Stably fits right into your existing development workflow, providing notifications via Slack, GitHub, and more when tests are run or issues arise.
- **Wide Compatibility**: It works with most popular test automation frameworks like Playwright, Cypress, and Selenium.

### Growing Pains and Future Plans

Currently, Stably's testing capabilities primarily target web applications, but the development of mobile testing is already in the pipeline. The team is small‚Äîjust seven people‚Äîbut they're making significant strides in transforming the testing landscape with AI.

### Trusted by Innovators

Stably is already being utilized by fast-growing companies, earning praise for reducing bugs and increasing user conversion rates. They‚Äôve made a name for themselves, with testimonials from CTOs and co-founders who value the assurance they get from using Stably, freeing up time to focus on building great products.

### The Path Forward

As Stably continues to grow and evolve, it‚Äôs positioned well to transform QA testing from a tedious process into a seamless, automated experience. Their approach is not just about catching bugs; it‚Äôs about instilling confidence in product releases and improving overall user experiences.

### Get Involved

If you're ready to stop treating your customers as beta testers and want to see how Stably can enhance your development process, head over to [Stably's website](https://www.stably.ai) and set up your first test in under five minutes.

In a world where speed and quality are paramount, Stably is carving out its niche and changing the way we think about software testing.
